index.name: network-protocols
index.subtitle: Network Protocols
index.about: A communication protocol is a system of rules that allow two or more entities of a communications system to transmit information via any kind of variation of a physical quantity. These are the rules or standard that defines the syntax, semantics and synchronization of communication and possible error recovery methods. Protocols may be implemented by hardware, software, or a combination of both.
index.description: Read free books and learn about the most used protocols in the internet.

books.title: High Performance Browser Networking
books.description: You’ll then dive into performance characteristics of technologies such as HTTP 2.0, client-side network scripting with XHR, real-time streaming with SSE and WebSocket, and P2P communication with WebRTC.
books.author: Ilya Grigorik

books.title: HTTP2 Explained
books.description: The book HTTP2 Explained describes the protocol HTTP/2 at a technical and protocol level. Background, the protocol, the implementations and the future.
books.author: Daniel Stenberg

books.title: HTTP Succinctly
books.description: With HTTP Succinctly, you’ll learn all about something you use on a daily basis.
books.author: Scott Allen
